channel.title: Looking for a Cell phone
channel.description:
I don't really know where to start, just that I need a new phone before mine finishes dieing. I've only owned 2 phones in my life, a Motorola Razor (which was great, rock solid, my grandma is still using it!) and a Motorola Krzr (POS, I've had 3, the best lasted 6 months, the other lasted 3 and this one is acting funny and will die any day).
I have to stay with verizon as a carrier, and my zip code is 45005. I know what I am looking for and what I am not looking for in a phone, but I have no idea how to find it or what sites there are to best assist me. I'll make a list here and hopefully someone can help.
What I need:
[ul][li]will work with verizon as carrier[/li] [li]ssh client[/li] [li]full keyboard[/li] [li]ability to write my own software for the phone (preferably without 'jailbreaking' it or anything)[/li] [li]comfortable to use[/li][/ul]
What I want:
[ul][li]Linux based OS[/li] [li]web browser[/li] [li]chat client (multiple protocols?)[/li] [li]support for wifi so I don't have to pay the ridiculous bandwidth prices[/li] [li]good battery life?[/li] [li]ability to connect to computer (USB connection or similar, no funky cords)[/li][/ul]
What I DON'T want:
[ul][li]windows based OS[/li][/ul]
Is this list doable at all? Does anyone have any first hand experience with this sort of thing? I would really appreciate any help anyone can give, and I will pay you back by being a better admin because of my ability to fix problems from anywhere I have phone service at.

item.title: Looking for a Cell phone
item.dc:creator: @Cruzer Cruzer
item.description:
@Cruzer wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:45, topic:301320”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=397632.msg3023920#msg3023920 date=1257763816]

i dont even think the droid is available in the UK

my mate has one, so i assume it is

ive never seen it advertised and i tried looking at some carriers websites and still nothing, it wasnt even on the samsung UK site

It wouldn’t be on the samsung site considering its the Motorola Droid.

lol that would explain it then
EDIT: Still couldnt find it i found this whihc looks similar but im not sure
[/quote]

That isn’t it. It doesn’t appear to have it, because when I view all the phones and click ‘phones with android operating system’ it only shows that one.

Anyway, found out I could stream last.fm radio to my phone, and also use it as a metal detector, cool stuff. I also have the ability to ssh to all of my servers with private key authentication and have multiple sessions open, so if anything goes down with the servers I can fix it right away.

Now if I could only get a Google Voice invite I would be good to go…[/quote]
gonna need an email

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a Cell phone
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

[quote=“sanga282, post:44, topic:301320”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=397632.msg3023768#msg3023768 date=1257738708]

i dont even think the droid is available in the UK

my mate has one, so i assume it is

ive never seen it advertised and i tried looking at some carriers websites and still nothing, it wasnt even on the samsung UK site

It wouldn’t be on the samsung site considering its the Motorola Droid.

[/quote]
lol that would explain it then
EDIT: Still couldnt find it i found this whihc looks similar but im not sure[/quote]

That isn’t it. It doesn’t appear to have it, because when I view all the phones and click ‘phones with android operating system’ it only shows that one.

Anyway, found out I could stream last.fm radio to my phone, and also use it as a metal detector, cool stuff. I also have the ability to ssh to all of my servers with private key authentication and have multiple sessions open, so if anything goes down with the servers I can fix it right away.

Now if I could only get a Google Voice invite I would be good to go…

Read full topic

item.title: Looking for a Cell phone
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

So verizon is CDMA? Get an HTC Harrier and put linux on it: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vD9hxpFGdGc&feature=channel_page that is my old one running wm2003

This works with the pda2k/Blueangel (GSM version) but it should also work with the Harrier with a few mods.

http://wiki.xda-developers.com/index.php?pagename=Xanadux

Here is a blueangel running android:

Here is my old blueangel running wm 6.5:
